example.eg: Lola screamed when she felt the spider creeping along her arm.
example.egtrans: 洛拉感觉到蜘蛛在她手臂上爬的时候惊声尖叫。

example.eg: Ivy has crept up the walls, almost covering the windows.
example.egtrans: 墙上爬满了常青藤，窗户都几乎要被封起来了。

example.eg: The day crept by, and finally it was time to go home.
example.egtrans: 今天一点点的过去，终于到回家的时间了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 缓慢地行进, 匍匐前进, 蹑手蹑脚地移动

example.eg: Kate watched the creep of the moonlight across the roof.  At rush hour, traffic moves at a creep.
example.egtrans: 凯特看到月光渐渐爬上屋顶。上下班高峰期，交通缓慢地行进着。

example.eg: That creep keeps staring at me.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 讨厌鬼, 思想怪异的人

example.eg: Only a creep would laugh at the boss's dumb jokes.
example.egtrans: 只有马屁精才会配合老板的蠢笑话放声大笑。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 谄媚之人, 奉承别人的人, 马屁精

example.eg: Stress and high temperatures caused creep in the turbine's blades.
example.egtrans: 压力与高温会导致涡轮中的叶片变形。

example.eg: Arriving home drunk again, he tried to creep in unnoticed.

dsense.name: creep in
dsense.guideword: figurative (thought, feeling: slowly enter) (比喻思想、感情等)

example.eg: In the beginning, she could never have imagined he would be unfaithful to her, but doubts began to creep in.
example.egtrans: 一开始，她从没有想象过他会不忠，但渐渐的，她开始怀疑起来。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 渐渐泛起, 渐渐生出

example.eg: The man in black crept quietly into the bushes.
example.egtrans: 黑衣人悄悄躲进了灌木丛中。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 悄悄爬进, 蹑手蹑脚地进入, 溜进

example.eg: A pessimistic tone has crept into his recent novels.
I don't like the way he looks at me; he creeps me out.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使...毛骨悚然, 让...觉得不自在

example.eg: A sense of resentment began to creep over her.
When the thunder started, the dog crept under the bed and stayed there until it stopped.
When Gary crept up and tapped me on the shoulder, I jumped.
example.egtrans: 加里从我身后悄悄溜过来，拍了拍我的肩膀，下了我一大跳。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 悄悄走近, 蹑手蹑脚地走上前来, 偷偷摸摸走近

example.eg: House prices have crept up by several thousand since we bought our home.
example.egtrans: 自我们买房以来，房价不知不觉已上涨几千元了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 逐渐增长, 逐渐上涨

example.eg: She startled her sister by creeping up on her and shouting "Boo!"

dsense.name: creep up on [sb]
dsense.guideword: figurative (fact, situation: arrive unforeseen) (不可预知的情况)

example.eg: You had better start working now; don't let the deadline creep up on you.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 渐渐地到来, 不知不觉地到来

example.eg: One way of avoiding scope creep is to define the limits of a project very precisely.
